example.code:
PS C:\>$option1 = New-Object -TypeName Amazon.EC2.Model.DhcpConfiguration PS C:\>$option1.Key = "domain-name" PS C:\>$option1.Values = "abc.local"
PS C:\>$option2 = New-Object -TypeName Amazon.EC2.Model.DhcpConfiguration PS C:\>$option2.Key = "domain-name-servers" PS C:\>$option2.Values = @("10.0.0.101","10.0.0.102")
PS C:\>$options = @($option1, $option2) PS C:\>New-EC2DhcpOption -DhcpConfiguration $options
example.description: This command uses PowerShell's New-Object cmdlet to build the set of options to pass to the -DhcpConfiguration parameter.
This command uses PowerShell's hash-table and array syntax to create the set of options to pass to the -DhcpConfiguration parameter.
